Following content is of title: CONSULTING SERVICES AGREEMENT is This Consulting Services Agreement (together with all of the exhibits and attachments hereto, this “Consulting Services Agreement,” with all of the Purchase Orders and Statements of Work, collectively the “Agreement”) is entered into (the “Effective Date”), by and between Fiserv Solutions, LLC, a Wisconsin limited liability company having an office at 255 Fiserv Drive, Brookfield, WI 53045, (“Fiserv”) and Xebia USA INC, a Delaware Corporation, having its principal place of business at Suite # 1100, 11th floor, Buckhead Tower at Lenox Square, 3399 Peachtree Road NE, Atlanta, Georgia, 30326 (“Consultant”) (each a “Party”; together, the “Parties”).

Following content is of title: ARTICLE 1: DEFINITIONS is 1.1 “Affiliate” shall mean an entity that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with a Party, where “control” means the direct or indirect ownership of more than 40% of the voting securities of such entity or Party. 1.2 “Auditable Records” shall mean accurate auditable evidence maintained in any type of media, including, but not limited to, records, timesheets (or time tracking systems of any type), employment records, work specifications, project management notes and reports, consulting charges, invoices, travel and living expenses, receipts and employee expense records, which are the basis of, or otherwise relate to, any fees, expenses or other charges to Fiserv under any SOW for Services. 1.3 “Change of Control” shall mean: (a) outstanding stock representing 33% or more of the voting rights of a Party’s shareholders, or outstanding stock representing 50% or more of the equity ownership of a Party, or all or substantially all of a Party’s assets are sold, transferred, assigned or merged; (b) a Party assigns (other than by a change in controlling interest or a sale of all or substantially all of its assets) to a third party any of its rights and obligations under this Agreement; (c) a Party sells a line of business or division that performs any Services hereunder whether by asset sale, stock sale, merger or otherwise; or (d) any other transaction or series of transactions that result in a change of Control of a Party. 1.4 “Confidential Information” shall mean material or information, in any form, which is confidential or proprietary to Disclosing Party and not generally known by third parties, whether or not designated as Confidential Information by Disclosing Party. Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, the following types of information and other information of a similar nature (whether or not reduced to writing and regardless of the form of media): systems manuals, decision processes, profiles, system and management architectures, discoveries, ideas, know-how, concepts or inventions (whether patented or not), software in various stages of development, business methods, processes, strategic plans or methodologies, marketing techniques and materials, marketing and development plans and procedures, Fiserv Data, price lists, pricing policies, business or financial information, plans, strategies, forecasts, forecast assumptions, trade secrets, and business practices. Confidential Information also includes any: (a) information described above which belongs to a third party, is disclosed to or access by Recipient hereunder, and with respect to which Disclosing Party owes a duty of confidentiality; (b) information which is jointly developed by the Parties and which either Party treats as proprietary or confidential; (c) information that, by its nature or the circumstances surrounding its disclosure, Recipient reasonably ought to know is confidential; and (d) notes, memoranda, analyses or abstracts relating to or containing Confidential Information. 1.5 “Customer” shall mean any person to whom or entity to which Fiserv or an Affiliate of Fiserv provides, or is actively attempting to provide, products or services. 1.6 “Deliverables” shall mean any ideas, know-how, documents, studies, materials, reports, data, plans, documentation, products, software (including source code and object code) or other materials in whatever form or any concept or design relating thereto developed in whole or part under any SOW or otherwise created by Consultant as a result of or related to the performance of the Services, including all intellectual property rights related thereto. 1.7 “Disclosing Party” shall mean the Party disclosing Confidential Information. 1 Fiserv CONFIDENTIAL 2/2023  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 1.8 “Fiserv Data” shall mean any data or information pertaining to Fiserv, its Affiliates, and/or their respective Customers or employees which is generated, collected, received, or accessed by Consultant in connection with performing the Services, including without limitation PII. As between the Parties, Fiserv Data is Fiserv’s Confidential Information. 1.9 “Intellectual Property” shall mean, to the extent that any of the following are recognized in any jurisdiction world-wide: (a) intellectual property and/or proprietary rights, whether registered or unregistered, including without limitation copyrights and patent rights (including without limitation applications for patent protection); (b) publicity rights, trade dress, registered or otherwise protected trademarks, trade names, service marks and protections from trademark dilution; (c) trade secrets, as defined in the Uniform Trade Secret Act or its successor, or its equivalent in the applicable jurisdiction; and (d) proprietary products, services, know-how, techniques, business

Following content is of title: ARTICLE 1: DEFINITIONS is service marks and protections from trademark dilution; (c) trade secrets, as defined in the Uniform Trade Secret Act or its successor, or its equivalent in the applicable jurisdiction; and (d) proprietary products, services, know-how, techniques, business processes, configurations, and business methods. 1.10 “Personnel” shall mean any agent, employee, or subcontractor employed or retained in any way, on a full or part time basis, by Consultant or any of its Affiliates, as well as any employee or agent of a subcontractor of Consultant or any of its Affiliates. 1.11 “PII” shall mean any personally identifiable information, defined as information that can be identified to a particular person without unreasonable effort, such as the names and social security numbers of individual consumers, individual Customers of Fiserv or its Affiliates, or employees of Fiserv or its Affiliates. 1.12 “Pre-existing Intellectual Property” shall mean products, software, ideas, skills, tools, techniques, processes and other Intellectual Property of a Party which it can convincingly evidence through written documentation as its Intellectual Property to be in existence prior to the Effective Date. 1.13 “Purchase Order” or “PO” shall mean a purchase order issued by Fiserv to Consultant for the purchase of the Services. Each Purchase Order will be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Consulting Services Agreement. 1.14 “Recipient” shall mean the Party that receives or otherwise has access to Confidential Information of the other Party. 1.15 “Services” shall mean any implementation, conversion, training, consulting or other professional services provided by Consultant to Fiserv pursuant to this Agreement and one or more SOW(s). 1.16 “Statement of Work” or “SOW” shall mean a statement of work executed by Consultant and Fiserv pursuant to which Consultant will provide Services to Fiserv, a sample attached as Exhibit B. Each SOW will be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Consulting Services Agreement. 1.17 “Subcontractor” shall mean any Affiliate of Consultant, any subcontractor of Consultant or any of its Affiliates, or any other third party to which Consultant subcontracts any portion of the Services hereunder.

Following content is of title: ARTICLE 2: SERVICES is 2.1 Scope of Services. Consultant agrees to perform the Services, including providing any Deliverables, as set forth in or contemplated by any SOW. Except as the Parties may expressly agree in writing, each SOW shall be governed in all respects by the terms and conditions of this Agreement. In the event of conflict between this Agreement and a SOW, this Agreement shall control with respect to the subject matter thereof. 2.2 Changes in Scope of SOW. Subject to any additional requirements described in an applicable SOW hereunder, either Party may propose changes to the scope of the SOW by delivery of a written notification to the other Party describing the desired changes (“Change Request”). The Party proposing the change(s) to the scope of the SOW shall provide with the Change Request an estimate of the effect on the cost and time of delivery associated with the Change Request. Fiserv shall have the right to reject or approve, in its sole reasonable discretion, any Change Request proposed by Consultant. No SOW will be 2 Fiserv CONFIDENTIAL 2/2023  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 modified or changed until the Parties execute a written change order (“Change Order”) or amendment to the applicable SOW. 2.3 Performance Schedule; Delays. Any delay in the performance schedule caused by Consultant may impact the fee payment as described in the applicable SOW. If any delays in Consultant’s performance occur as a result of a material failure to cooperate or untimely performance by Fiserv, Consultant shall not incur any liability for its non-performance under the applicable SOW as a result of such delay. 2.4 Acceptance of Deliverables. Following receipt of a Deliverable or performance of Services, Fiserv shall have at least 15 business days (“Review Period”) to review and accept such Deliverable or Services. If Fiserv identifies any nonconformity or defect with respect to the Deliverables or Services within such Review Period, then Consultant will have no more than 10 days in which to remedy all nonconformities and/or defects, after which, if such nonconformities and/or defects are not cured in Fiserv’s reasonable opinion, Fiserv may, at its option, terminate this Agreement and/or any outstanding SOWs immediately without further payment obligation and receive a refund of any amounts already paid with respect to such Deliverables and Services. 2.5 Assignment of Personnel. Consultant shall consult with Fiserv in determining which of its employees and/or other personnel shall be assigned to perform the Services hereunder. Consultant shall not replace or reassign such person(s) during the term of the applicable SOW without Fiserv’s prior written consent. If Fiserv believes that any individual assigned by Consultant to perform the Services is not in the best interests of Fiserv, then Fiserv shall have the right to request a replacement for such individual. If the problem cannot be resolved within five days after such request by Fiserv, then Consultant shall replace such individual with another individual, who, to the reasonable satisfaction of Fiserv, possesses the skills and experience necessary to provide the Services and Deliverables. Upon request from Fiserv, Consultant shall identify all Personnel performing any Services hereunder. In no event shall Consultant assign or permit any former Fiserv employee to perform Services for Fiserv (or otherwise have access to any Fiserv information or data) without Fiserv's prior written consent. 2.6 Fiserv Affiliates. Any Affiliate of Fiserv may execute SOWs under this Agreement in its sole discretion. In that event, all references to “Fiserv” herein shall refer to such Affiliate for purposes of the applicable SOW.

Following content is of title: ARTICLE 3: COMPENSATION; TAXES is 3.1 Fees. Fiserv will pay Consultant the amount specified in each SOW or PO, as applicable, for all Services performed thereunder. 3.2 Invoices. (a) Consultant will invoice Fiserv in accordance with the applicable SOW or PO or, if not specified in the SOW or PO, then on a monthly basis for charges incurred for Services rendered during the preceding month. Consultant agrees to issue invoices and accept PO’s through the electronic procurement tool designated by Fiserv (Ariba SAP/Fieldglass). (b) Unless otherwise agreed to in a SOW, or specified by Fiserv in a PO, all invoices must: (i) be sent to the address set forth in the SOW or PO, or otherwise provided by an authorized representative of Fiserv; (ii) reference any applicable number set forth in the SOW or PO; (iii) include a detailed description of the Services performed (including the names of individuals performing Services where the Services are being performed on a time and materials (“T&M”) basis); (iv) include the performance period(s) and relevant dates; 3 Fiserv CONFIDENTIAL 2/2023  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 (v) include reimbursable expenses (including specific categories for airfare, accommodations, transportation and meals), if applicable; (vi) reference the applicable Fiserv business representative; and (vii) include a unique invoice number. (c) Fiserv reserves the right to reject and return for correction any invoice that: (i) does not reflect the required information; or (ii) does not conform to Fiserv invoicing terms as specified in this Agreement or an applicable SOW or PO. (d) All invoices submitted by Consultant shall be due and payable within 60 (Sixty) days of receipt of a correct invoice, except as otherwise set forth in Section 3.4 below. At Fiserv’s discretion, payments may be made via EFT. 3.3 Taxes. Fiserv is responsible for any legally required sales and use tax on Services covered in this Agreement. If applicable, Consultant shall indicate on the invoice the amount of such tax and the jurisdiction to which the tax will be remitted. In the event Fiserv reasonably disagrees with the applicability of any invoiced taxes, Fiserv shall have the right to reduce the invoice by the amount of such taxes. In no event shall Fiserv be responsible for taxes based on Consultant’s net or gross income, capital, property or employees, nor shall Fiserv be responsible for any penalties, fines, or interest resulting from Consultant’s improper or untimely collection or remittance of taxes. Where required by law, Fiserv may withhold from payment any taxes which it is required to pay in connection with its purchases under this Agreement. In the event Fiserv enjoys any tax exemptions, provided that Fiserv provides reasonable evidence of such exemption(s), Consultant shall honor such exemption(s). In the event Fiserv reasonably disputes a tax hereunder, Consultant shall reasonably cooperate with Fiserv in disputing any such tax and/or seeking to recover any such tax from any taxing authority. 3.4 Disputes. If there exists a good faith dispute with regard to an item appearing on an invoice, Fiserv has the right to withhold such disputed amount while the Parties attempt to resolve the dispute in accordance with Article 8, provided that Fiserv provides Consultant with notice of such dispute on or before the due date of the disputed invoice. Fiserv’s withholding of such disputed amount shall not constitute a breach of this Agreement, nor shall it be grounds for Consultant to suspend or terminate its performance of Services, so long as Fiserv pays on a timely basis those amounts that are undisputed. 3.5 Expenses. Unless otherwise agreed upon in a SOW, Fiserv will not reimburse Consultant for travel or other expenses incurred by Consultant or any Personnel in connection with providing Services under this Agreement. If such expenses are to be reimbursed, they must be pre-approved in writing by Fiserv and comply with Fiserv’s travel and expense policy, a copy of which will be provided upon request. All expenses shall be itemized on invoices submitted by Consultant.
Following content is of title: ARTICLE 4: CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION AND SECURITY is

Following content is of title: 4.1 Disclosure and Use. is (a) Recipient may be given access to Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information. Recipient will protect Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information from any unauthorized use, disclosure, copying, dissemination or distribution as it would protect its own Confidential Information, which shall be by no means less than a reasonable degree of care and as required by law. Recipient will only use the Confidential Information for the following “Permitted Purposes”: (i) to perform its obligations under this Agreement; and, (ii) in the case of Fiserv, to derive the reasonable and intended benefit of the Services and Deliverables provided pursuant to this Agreement. Recipient specifically agrees not to use or disclose any “non-public personal information” about Disclosing Party’s customers in any manner prohibited by Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act or the regulations issued thereunder (“GLB”), as applicable to Recipient. Recipient will only disclose Confidential Information those of its and its Affiliates’ 4 Fiserv CONFIDENTIAL 2/2023  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 employees, agents, contractors, and subcontractors who have a direct “need to know” for a Permitted Purpose and who are subject to written obligations of confidentiality which are no less restrictive than those contained herein. Recipient shall be responsible for any breach of this Article 4 by any such individuals or entities. Recipient has implemented and shall maintain an information security program that is designed to meet the following objectives: (i) protect the security and confidentiality of customer information (as defined in GLB); (ii) protect against any anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such information; (iii) protect against unauthorized access to or use of such information that could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer; and (iv) ensure the proper disposal of “consumer information” (information obtained from “consumer reports” as defined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act). Recipient shall also take appropriate actions to address incidents of unauthorized access to Disclosing Party’s “sensitive customer information” (as defined in GLB), including notification to Disclosing Party as soon as possible of any misuse of or unauthorized access to Confidential Information of which it becomes aware and cooperation in the remediation of such situation promptly. (b) Recipient may disclose Confidential Information to the extent required by law or legal process, provided that: (i) Recipient first gives Disclosing Party prompt notice, if legally permissible, so that Disclosing Party may seek a protective order; (ii) Recipient reasonably cooperates with Disclosing Party (at Disclosing Party’s expense) in seeking such protective order; (iii) if Disclosing Party cannot obtain a protective order, Recipient only discloses the Confidential Information that in the reasonable opinion of its legal counsel is required to be disclosed; and (iv) all such Confidential Information required to be disclosed shall remain subject to the obligations in this Agreement. (c) As between the Parties, all Confidential Information is the property of Disclosing Party. This Agreement will not be interpreted or construed as granting any license or any other Intellectual Property right to Recipient for any Confidential Information. (d) Recipient will comply with any and all applicable laws relating to the use, disclosure, copying, dissemination and distribution of any Confidential Information (including, but not limited to, any and all laws relating to proprietary rights or the export of any technical data included in such Confidential Information). (e) Upon the request of Disclosing Party, Recipient shall promptly return to Disclosing Party or destroy all Confidential Information; in either case, any and all copies of Confidential Information will be destroyed. Recipient will provide a written affidavit certifying that all Confidential Information has been returned or destroyed in compliance with this Section 4.1(e). (f) Recipient will not alter, remove or obliterate markings (if any) on Confidential Information indicating its ownership, proprietary or confidential nature. (g) If any Recipient employee or individual performing work for Recipient as a contractor or consultant (collectively “Employee”) receives Confidential Information for Permitted Purposes, and Recipient has an agreement with Employee that (a) contains a provision governing the use of a trade secret or other confidential information and (b) is entered into or updated after May 11, 2016, Recipient shall ensure that any such agreement includes the following notifications or a cross-reference to a policy document containing the following notifications: (i) Pursuant to 18 U.S.C § 1833(b)(1): “An individual shall not be held criminally or civilly liable under any Federal or State trade secret law for the disclosure of a trade secret that (A) is made (i) in confidence to a Federal, State, or local government official, either directly or indirectly,

Following content is of title: 4.1 Disclosure and Use. is be held criminally or civilly liable under any Federal or State trade secret law for the disclosure of a trade secret that (A) is made (i) in confidence to a Federal, State, or local government official, either directly or indirectly, or to an attorney; and (ii) solely for the purpose of reporting or investigating a suspected violation of law; or (B) is made in a complaint or other document filed in a lawsuit or other proceeding, if such filing is made under seal.” 5 Fiserv CONFIDENTIAL 2/2023  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 (ii) Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. § 1833(b)(2): “An individual who files a lawsuit for retaliation by an employer for reporting a suspected violation of law may disclose the trade secret to the attorney of the individual and use the trade secret information in the court proceeding, if the individual (A) files any document containing the trade secret under seal; and (B) does not disclose the trade secret, except pursuant to court order.” 4.2 Exclusions. Confidential Information will not include information which (as evidenced by written documentation): is or becomes available to the general public through no fault of Recipient; (b) is developed by Recipient without breach of this Agreement or aid of Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information; or (c) is rightfully received by Recipient through no breach of confidentiality obligation from a third party without a duty of confidentiality. 4.3 Equitable Relief. Disclosing Party may suffer irreparable harm in the event that Recipient fails to comply with the terms of this Agreement. Monetary damages may be inadequate to compensate for such breach. Accordingly, in addition to any other remedies available to it at law or in equity, Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief to enforce the terms of this Agreement without the requirement of having to post bond. 4.4 Security Addendum. Consultant shall comply with the Security Addendum attached hereto in Exhibit A, Annex B, Part B. 4.5 Data Processing Addendum. The terms of the data processing addendum (“DPA”) attached hereto as Exhibit A are hereby incorporated by reference and shall apply to the extent Fiserv Data includes personal data, as defined in the DPA.

Following content is of title: ARTICLE 5: OWNERSHIP; IP MATTERS is 5.1 Unless otherwise expressly set forth in a SOW, Fiserv will own all Intellectual Property rights in any Deliverables, and all Deliverables are deemed “works made for hire.” Consultant and Fiserv each acknowledge that the performance of the Services may result in the discovery, creation and development of Deliverables. Delivery to Fiserv shall constitute a transfer to Fiserv by Consultant of all Intellectual Property rights therein. All Deliverables discovered, created or developed under this Agreement shall be and remain the sole and exclusive property of Fiserv. In the event Deliverables do not fall within the specifically enumerated works that constitute “works made for hire” under United States copyright laws, Consultant hereby assigns all tangible and intangible Intellectual Property and other right title and interest in the Deliverables to Fiserv. Consultant agrees to execute any other documents necessary to perfect title in any Deliverable for Fiserv. Further: (a) Consultant will retain all right, title and interest to its Pre-existing Intellectual Property; (b) to the extent that Pre-existing Intellectual Property has been incorporated into or is embedded in the Deliverables, Fiserv will have a perpetual, nonexclusive, non-terminable, world-wide, royalty-free right to use, execute, modify, reproduce, display, perform, and prepare derivative works based on such Pre-existing Intellectual Property to support and make full use of the Deliverables.; (c) Consultant will promptly and fully disclose to Fiserv any and all work for hire and Deliverables generated, conceived, reduced to practice or learned by Consultant or Personnel, either solely or jointly with others, during and under the Term of this Agreement, which in any way relates to the business or operations of Fiserv; and (d) 6 Fiserv CONFIDENTIAL 2/2023  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 neither Consultant nor its Personnel shall use or disclose any information relating to Deliverables except as necessary in the performance of the Services. 5.2 In the event that the Parties expressly agree in a SOW that Consultant will own of all or some portion of the Deliverables, then with respect to such Deliverables, the terms set forth in this Section 5.2 shall apply. Consultant hereby grants to Fiserv and its Affiliates a global, royalty-free, fully paid-up, non- exclusive, and perpetual right and license to use, execute, modify, reproduce, display, perform, and prepare derivative works based on such Deliverables to support and make full use of the Deliverables. For the avoidance of doubt, Fiserv does not grant, assign or in any way transfer any right, entitlement, privilege, permission, claim, title, ownership or interest in any of its Intellectual Property or other Confidential Information, either implicitly or explicitly, by operation of law or otherwise 5.3 Consultant shall not, without the prior written consent of Fiserv, introduce, embed, or utilize any third party software or other intellectual property (“Third Party Material”) in any Deliverable, or in the performance of the Services hereunder. To the extent Fiserv provides such consent, Consultant hereby grants Fiserv and its Affiliates a perpetual, fully paid up, royalty-free, non-exclusive, world-wide, irrevocable license to use such Third Party Material for the benefit of Fiserv and its Affiliates in connection with the use of the Deliverables created hereunder, and the Parties will mutually agree on applicable terms for support of any such Third Party Material after expiration or termination of this Agreement. Consultant shall be responsible for any fees, expenses or costs resulting from its embedding of any Third Party Material within any Deliverables provided or developed under this Agreement.

Following content is of title: ARTICLE 6: CONSULTANT RESPONSIBILITIES is 6.1 Publicity. Consultant will not use the name(s), trademark(s) or trade name(s) of Fiserv or its Affiliates without Fiserv’s prior written consent. Consultant shall not use Fiserv’s or its Affiliates’ name(s), logo(s), trademark(s) or other symbol(s) in advertising or publicity releases or publicly distributed materials, including, without limitation, customer lists or links to any Fiserv website, without Fiserv’s prior written consent. Such prior written consent may only be granted by a Senior Vice President of Fiserv. Furthermore, Consultant shall not claim or suggest, implicitly or explicitly, that Fiserv’s or its Affiliates’ use of the Deliverable or Services constitutes an endorsement by Fiserv or any of its Affiliates of such Deliverable or Services. 6.2 Legal Status/Regulatory Changes. Consultant shall notify Fiserv, in writing, as soon as reasonably practicable upon becoming aware of any regulatory issues, arbitration, or litigation, pending or active, that may affect Consultant's performance under this Agreement or any SOW. 6.3 Screening Procedures. The screening procedures set forth below shall apply to all Personnel who: (i) have access to any of Fiserv’s Confidential Information; (ii) have the ability to manipulate Fiserv’s finance or accounting data; (iii) have access to Fiserv’s networks or systems; or (iv) perform Services on Fiserv’s premises without supervision by a Fiserv associate. (a) PROCEDURES. Consultant shall cause to be performed, at its sole expense, each of the following checks and screenings on all such Personnel prior to the start of their assignment with Fiserv. Such screenings shall have been performed within the past five years of the date on which such Personnel commences an assignment with Fiserv, and the criminal convictions search shall be re-performed every five years. (i) Criminal History Report. A criminal convictions search for the preceding seven year period shall be conducted. Subject to applicable law, no Personnel who have been convicted of or accepted responsibility for a felony of any type or a misdemeanor involving theft, fraud, embezzlement, or money laundering or which is otherwise 7 Fiserv CONFIDENTIAL 2/2023  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 related to dishonesty or a breach of trust shall be assigned to, or permitted to continue an assignment with, Fiserv. (ii) Drug Test. A drug test, which shall consist of a 10 panel urinalysis test, shall be conducted at a laboratory certified by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA). Any Personnel with a confirmed positive test will be denied assignment to Fiserv. (iii) Global Watch List. A check against the U.S. Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control’s (OFAC), “Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons” (SDN) database shall be conducted, and any Personnel appearing in such database shall not be assigned to, or permitted to continue an assignment with, Fiserv. (b) MONITORING. In the event that Consultant becomes aware of a fact or circumstance following the date of assignment to Fiserv which would have resulted in Personnel failing to pass one of the foregoing screening procedures (e.g., if the person is convicted of a felony after the date of his or her assignment to Fiserv), Consultant shall immediately remove such Personnel from Fiserv’s account, project, and/or premises, as appropriate, and no longer permit such Personnel to perform Services for Fiserv. From time to time, upon Fiserv’s request, Consultant shall provide Fiserv with documentation or other evidence reasonably acceptable to Fiserv to evidence that it has complied with the foregoing provisions. 6.4 Fiserv Policies and Procedures. While performing the Services, Consultant will abide by Fiserv’s then-current standard safety and security procedures and policies, as Fiserv may communicate to Consultant from time to time. When assigned to perform work at a Fiserv location, all Personnel will also comply with Fiserv’s policies regarding dress and appearance, professional conduct and any other reasonable work rules, regulations and instructions applicable to Fiserv employees generally, as Fiserv may communicate to Consultant from time to time. 6.5 Consultant Hardware & Software. Consultant will not bring any hardware or software onto Fiserv’s premises unless such items are necessary for Consultant to perform Services under this Agreement. All such hardware and software is subject to inspection and/or scanning by Fiserv before Consultant may use said items on Fiserv’s premises. Consultant will obtain approval from and comply with the directives provided by Fiserv prior

Following content is of title: ARTICLE 6: CONSULTANT RESPONSIBILITIES is Services under this Agreement. All such hardware and software is subject to inspection and/or scanning by Fiserv before Consultant may use said items on Fiserv’s premises. Consultant will obtain approval from and comply with the directives provided by Fiserv prior to connecting any hardware to Fiserv’s systems or network. 6.6 Use of Fiserv Equipment. Fiserv may lend to Consultant the following for use during the Term of the Agreement or SOW (collectively referred to as “Fiserv Equipment”): (a) a laptop computer (“Fiserv Laptop”); (b) a Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) token; and/or (c) an access badge (“Badge”). Consultant agrees to: (i) store and process Confidential Information in electronic form only on the Fiserv Laptop; (ii) promptly transfer to the Fiserv Laptop any Confidential Information in electronic form that Consultant has previously stored elsewhere and securely and permanently delete it from its previous location; (iii) use the Fiserv Equipment only for performing Consultant’s obligations under this Agreement; (iv) refrain from installing any software or hardware (including USB flash drives or external storage devices) on the Fiserv Laptop except to accomplish (ii) above or as otherwise specifically authorized by Fiserv in writing; (v) keep the login IDs and passwords confidential; (vi) keep the Fiserv Equipment physically secure at all times, locked up when not in Consultant’s personal possession, and never checked as baggage on a flight; (vii) immediately inform Fiserv if the Fiserv Equipment is ever stolen, lost or missing; and (viii) complete a security awareness online course provided by Fiserv within two weeks of Consultant’s engagement and annually thereafter. 6.7 Offshore Resources. Consultant, Consultant Personnel and Subcontractors shall not perform the Services nor access Fiserv Data outside of the U.S. without Fiserv’s prior written consent.

Following content is of title: ARTICLE 7: TERM AND TERMINATION is 7.1 Term. The initial term of this Consulting Services Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for one year (the “Initial Term”). Thereafter, this Consulting Services Agreement shall 8 Fiserv CONFIDENTIAL 2/2023  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 automatically renew for successive one year terms (each, a “Renewal Term” and, together with the Initial Term and any other Renewal Terms, the “Term”) unless Fiserv provides notice of non-renewal at least 30 (thirty) days prior to the expiration of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term t. Notwithstanding the foregoing, this Consulting Services Agreement shall remain in effect with respect to any SOWs entered into hereunder which are not also terminated until all Services thereunder have been performed . Fiserv, in its discretion, may extend a SOW Term on an open ended engagement or temporary engagement by written notice, so long as the Parties agree on a weekly or monthly cap on the hours that can be performed by Consultant or fees that can be invoiced by Consultant under such engagement. 7.2 Termination for Cause. Either Party may terminate this Agreement or any SOW or PO for cause immediately upon written notice as follows: (a) for the other Party’s failure to materially comply with the terms of this Consulting Services Agreement or a SOW or PO (provided such breach, if capable of being cured, is not cured within 30 days after written notice is provided to the other Party); or (b) in the event the other Party becomes or is declared insolvent or bankrupt, is the subject of any proceedings relating to its liquidation, insolvency, or for the appointment of a receiver or similar officer for it, makes an assignment for the benefit of all or substantially all of its creditors or enters into an agreement for the composition, extension or readjustment of all or substantially all of its obligations. 7.3 Additional Right of Termination. Fiserv may also terminate this Agreement or any SOW or PO immediately upon written notice as follows upon a Change of Control of Consultant. 7.4 Termination for Convenience. Fiserv may terminate this Agreement or any SOW of PO for convenience upon 10 days written notice to Consultant. 7.5 Prepaid Fees. In the event Fiserv terminates this Agreement or any SOW or PO for any reason, Consultant shall reimburse Fiserv for all unearned fees which were prepaid by Fiserv.

Following content is of title: 1. Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery. is (a) Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan. (i) During the Term of the Agreement, Vendor shall maintain industry standard contingency and recovery plans and risk controls (collectively, a “Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan”) to ensure Vendor’s continued and uninterrupted performance of its obligations under the Agreement. Vendor shall have delivered a copy of its Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan, or a reasonably detailed summary thereof, prior to the execution of the Agreement and thereafter on each anniversary of the Effective Date. Vendor shall provide access to a full copy of its then-current Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan promptly following Fiserv’s written request. In the event Fiserv objects to the Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan or any portion thereof, Vendor shall respond in writing within 30 days of Fiserv’s objection setting forth the actions Vendor shall undertake to cure each such objection. Vendor agrees to comply with the terms of its Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan, including maintaining the capacity to execute such plan, during the Term. The Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan must include a pandemic response plan. (ii) Vendor will work with the building manager at the Data Center(s) at which the Services are performed and/or where Fiserv’s Confidential Information is stored to ensure that the building manager’s emergency response and pandemic response plans are compatible with Vendor’s Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan. At Fiserv’s request, Vendor will provide Fiserv with a written summary of any gaps or special considerations discovered in the building manager’s plans that could impact the SLAs or the support of the Services. (b) Notice Upon Use of Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan. Upon the occurrence of any event requiring use of Vendor’s Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan, Vendor shall immediately, not to exceed two hours after Vendor becomes aware of such event, notify Fiserv in writing of the same, and Vendor shall promptly provide Fiserv with information in reasonable detail regarding the use and success or failure of such Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan. 27  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 (c) BCP Test. Vendor will test its Business Continuity Plan no less than annually (a “BCP Test”), and, promptly thereafter, Vendor will provide Fiserv with a written summary of the results of a BCP Test. If any gaps or problems are revealed by a BCP Test, Vendor will also provide Fiserv with a remediation plan to address those gaps or problems to Fiserv’s reasonable satisfaction within 30 days from BCP Test execution. In addition, Vendor agrees to participate, at Fiserv’s expense, in Fiserv’s tests of its own business continuity & disaster recovery plan upon reasonable advance written request from Fiserv. (d) System Back-Up; Lost/Damaged Data. Vendor agrees to perform back-ups of its systems and data at least daily. Vendor shall, at its own expense, promptly replace or regenerate from Vendor’s machine-readable media any data, programs or information which Vendor has lost or damaged, or obtain, at Vendor’s own expense, a new copy of lost or damaged data, programs or information. Fiserv may, in its discretion, replace or regenerate any data, programs or information which Vendor has lost or damaged, or obtain a new copy of lost or damaged data, programs or information, and Vendor shall promptly reimburse Fiserv for all costs related to such replacement or regeneration. (e) Recovery Time Objective and Recovery Point Objective. Vendor shall meet a recovery time objective (“RTO”) of 24 hours and a recovery point objective (“RPO”) of 24 hours.

Without limiting either the foregoing or any other obligations contained herein with respect to Fiserv’s Confidential Information, Vendor represents and warrants that its Security Measures are designed to: (1) ensure the security and confidentiality of Fiserv’s Confidential Information; (2) protect against any anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such data; (3) protect against unauthorized access to or use of such data that 30  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any consumer, Fiserv or employee; (4) ensure the proper (i.e., in accordance with applicable law and Section 5(a) hereof) disposal of Fiserv’s Confidential Information; and (5) notify Fiserv as soon as possible and without undue delay (not to exceed two hours) if there is any evidence that an unauthorized use or disclosure of Fiserv’s Confidential Information may have occurred. For the avoidance of doubt, Fiserv’s Confidential Information includes Personal Data. All Fiserv Confidential Information shall be stored by Vendor on equipment located on Vendor’s premises and either physically or logically separated from the data of Vendor’s other clients. Vendor will document its compliance with this requirement, and the documentation will be available for Audit purposes, if requested by Fiserv. Vendor will document and record any drive failures or maintenance that will trigger data destruction tracking. Vendor will follow DOD- approved data destruction standards and processes, including industry-standard and commercially reasonable sign-offs and controls. Upon Fiserv’s request, Vendor will certify in writing that it has destroyed Fiserv Confidential Information in accordance with DOD-approved data destruction standards. (i) (ii) Vendor, its Affiliates and permitted Subcontractors shall implement and maintain an information and physical security program consistent with legal requirements and industry best practices (“Security Measures”) covering all Confidential Information obtained from or on behalf of Fiserv or its representatives, and Vendor will provide a summary of its Security Measures to Fiserv upon request at no additional charge. As part of the Security Measures, Vendor shall control and restrict access to its network on which any Fiserv Confidential Information is or may be stored. In addition, as part of the Security Measures, Vendor agrees to: (A) limit printouts, notes, photos, videos, audio recordings and other “recorded” versions of Fiserv Confidential Information to those that are reasonably necessary to perform its obligations under the Agreement; and (B) keep such records physically secure at all times, locked up when not in Vendor personnel’s possession, and never checked as baggage on a flight. (b) Technical and Organization Measures. Without limiting subsection (a)(ii) above, as part of the Security Measures, Vendor will adopt, maintain, and enforce all appropriate technical and organizational measures, including as required under ISO/IEC 27000 series of standards, Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) and Graham-Leach Bliley Act (GLBA), to protect all of Fiserv’s Confidential Information, including without limitation Fiserv Confidential Information and Consumer Data, against unauthorized or unlawful processing; accidental or unlawful loss, destruction, damage, theft, alteration or disclosure or access; or unauthorized disclosure, use, or access. These measures shall be appropriate to the harm which might result from such acts and have regard to the nature of Fiserv’s Confidential Information which is to be protected. Vendor shall implement and maintain effective distributed denial of service (“DDOS”) countermeasures. (c) Security Incidents. Vendor shall provide notice to Fiserv as soon as possible and without undue delay, not to exceed two hours after Vendor becomes aware of any evidence that any of the following has or may have occurred (hereinafter referred to as a “Security Incident”): (i) unauthorized or unlawful processing of; accidental or unlawful loss, destruction, damage, theft, alteration or disclosure of, or access to; or unauthorized disclosure or use of, or access to,, Fiserv’s Confidential Information; , including a denial of service attack; or any other issue which violates this Security Addendum. All Vendor Personnel who have access to Fiserv Confidential Information shall undergo Vendor’s security training on an annual basis covering sound privacy and information security practices generally and about its obligations under this Agreement (provided a summary copy has been provided to and approved by Fiserv prior to the Effective Date, and thereafter upon Fiserv’s request), or alternatively, undergo Fiserv’s Security Awareness Training on an annual basis. (g) Physical Security. (i) Prior to any visitor or contractor entering any Data Center Vendor shall capture that person’s identification information in a log, journal or other business record. Visitor badges are for identification purposes and do not provide any access to a Fiserv facility or its areas within. Visitor badges should indicate “Escort Required” on the badge and be worn at all times. (ii) Card access control will be used for Data Center access. Physical access cards will be issued to all of Vendor’s employees, and may be issued to contractors after successfully completion of Fiserv Personnel Screening requirements as specified in GSI Policy. Each person should “swipe” his/her access cards for access to ensure that no piggybacking or tailgating is permitted. The logs of entrance and exit activity will be kept for no less than one year. (iii) Visitors and Vendor Personnel will be escorted at all times to prevent access to systems to which they should not have access. (iv) Camera systems will be time-synchronized with the card access system(s) and will run the entire time while visitors and Vendor Personnel are on the Data Center floor. (v) Cameras will specifically view and monitor the infrastructure used to provide the Services and any other equipment or systems on which any Fiserv Confidential Information is hosted. Following content is of title: 6. Audit. is (a) Fiserv Audits. At any time during the Term and for a period of two years following expiration or termination of this Agreement, upon not less than 10 days’ prior written notice, Vendor, its Affiliates and permitted Subcontractors shall grant the internal and external auditors and personnel of Fiserv and its Affiliates and the customers of Fiserv and its Affiliates, and any examiners or agents from any regulatory body asserting jurisdiction over the business of Fiserv, any of Fiserv’s Affiliates or any of the customers of Fiserv or its Affiliates (collectively, the “Auditors”) reasonable access to Vendor (including, without limitation, access to records, systems, controls, processes and procedures related to performance of the Services by Vendor, its Affiliates and permitted Subcontractors) for the purpose of performing audits or examinations to verify Vendor’s compliance with this Agreement (a “Fiserv Audit” and together with a Vendor Audit, an “Audit”). Vendor shall reasonably cooperate with the Auditors and provide to the Auditors, in a timely manner, all such assistance as they may reasonably require in connection with any Audit. (b) Vendor Audits. Vendor employs an external auditor responsible for ensuring the integrity of its processing environments and internal controls. Vendor will audit the security of its computing environment and systems used to provide the Services to Fiserv no less frequently than on an annual basis and according to appropriate industry security standards, including without limitation as required for a Service Organization Control 1 (“SOC1”) and Service Organization Control 2 Type II (“SOC2”) audits (collectively, a “Vendor Audit”). ( Such Vendor Audit will produce one or more reports, including without limitation a SOC1, Type 2 report and SOC2 report (each, an “Audit Report”), and Vendor shall provide a copy of each Audit Report to Fiserv at no charge within a reasonable time after its completion. The Audit Reports may be reviewed by the Auditors. (c) Penetration Tests and Vulnerability Scans. Vendor shall perform the following scans and reviews and promptly provide Fiserv with the resultant reports: (i) monthly vulnerability scans on its externally facing infrastructure and on any network that processes, transmits, stores, or otherwise supports Fiserv’s Confidential Information; and (ii) quarterly entitlement reviews of its access controls, as they apply to Fiserv’s Confidential Information. On no less than an annual basis, Vendor shall perform an application penetration test and a penetration test of its externally facing and internal infrastructure and on any network that processes, transmits, stores, or otherwise supports Fiserv’s Confidential Information, and shall promptly provide Fiserv with the resultant reports. Additionally, Vendor shall perform an application penetration test when significant code changes or updates are made to the Software or other systems being used to provide the Services and shall promptly provide the resultant report(s) to Fiserv. Additionally, upon Fiserv’s written request and at its expense, Vendor shall permit Fiserv or its third-party designee to perform penetration testing and/or vulnerability scanning to test the security of the Software and/or systems used to provide the Services. Vendor shall remediate any findings resulting from any vulnerability scan, entitlement review, or penetration test as soon as commercially practicable; however, in the event such finding(s) affect Vendor’s ability to meet its obligations under this Security Addendum or to otherwise comply with its own Security Measures, such finding(s) shall be remediated within 10 days of discovery. 34  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 (d) Audit Remediation. Vendor will use commercially reasonable efforts within 30 days to remediate (i) any errors identified in an Audit that could reasonably be expected to have an adverse impact on the Services and (ii) material control deficiencies identified in the Audit, and, in any event, shall remediate all Audit findings within no more than 90 days from the date on which a summary of the Audit findings are provided to Vendor by Fiserv. If Fiserv reasonably and in good faith determines that the Audit findings are not being sufficiently remediated, Fiserv shall provide Vendor with written notice of its concerns. Within 10 days of its receipt thereof, Vendor shall provide Fiserv with a written statement indicating how it intends to remediate the findings and the timing with respect thereto (“Correction Plan”). If the Correction Plan is not reasonably acceptable to Fiserv or if Vendor fails to remedy the findings in accordance therewith, Fiserv may terminate the Agreement upon 15 days’ prior written notice without penalty, during which time Vendor may cure and avoid termination if the Audit findings are remedied to the reasonable satisfaction of Fiserv prior to the termination

Following content is of title: PART B Supplementary Measures is 1. The Parties shall ensure that the Vendor shall not have access to the personal data in clear-text. To ensure this: (a) Fiserv shall use strong encryption before transmission of the data to the Vendor and shall verify the identity of Vendor; (b) the encryption algorithm and its parameterization (e.g., key length, operating mode, if applicable) conform to the state-of-the-art and can be considered robust against cryptanalysis performed by public authorities in the recipient country taking into account the resources and technical capabilities; (c) the strength of the encryption and key length takes into account the specific time period during which the confidentiality of the encrypted personal data must be preserved; (d) the encryption algorithm is implemented correctly and by properly maintained software without known vulnerabilities the conformity of which to the specification of the algorithm chosen has been verified, e.g., by certification; (e) the keys are reliably managed (generated, administered, stored, if relevant, linked to the identity of an intended recipient, and revoked); and the keys are retained solely under the control of Fiserv, or by an entity trusted by Fiserv; The Parties shall ensure that the data is pseudonymised before transfer to the Vendor. To ensure this: 2. (a) Before transferring the personal data, Fiserv shall process it in such a manner that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject, nor be used to single out the data subject in a larger group without the use of additional information; (b) that additional information shall be held exclusively by Fiserv and kept separately in a Member State or in a third country, by an entity trusted by Fiserv in the EEA or under a jurisdiction offering an essentially equivalent level of protection to that guaranteed within the EEA; (c) Fiserv shall ensure that disclosure or unauthorised use of that additional information is prevented by appropriate technical and organisational safeguards; (d) Fiserv shall ensure that it retains sole control of the algorithm or repository that enables re-identification using the additional information; and (e) Fiserv has established by means of a thorough analysis of the data in question - taking into account any information that the public authorities of the recipient country may be expected to possess and use - that the pseudonymised personal data cannot be attributed to an identified or identifiable natural person even if cross-referenced with such information. The Vendor warrants and represents that it shall use its best efforts to aware of an actual or potential changes to the information that it has provided to Fiserv under clause 14c of the EU 3. 43  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 Standard Contractual Clauses and shall advise Fiserv within 48 hours of any actual or potential changes to such information. 4. The Vendor warrants and represents that: (a) it has not purposefully created back doors or similar programming that could be used to access the personal data processed in connection with this Addendum; (b) it has not purposefully created or changed its business processes in a manner that facilitates access to such personal data; and (c) law or government policy to which Vendor is subject does not require the Vendor to create or maintain back doors or to facilitate access to such personal data; and (d) if the personal data processed by Vendor is encrypted, Vendor is not obliged to be in possession or to hand over the encryption key; (e) it will notify Fiserv if, at any time it is unable to continue complying with this commitment and agrees that Fiserv may terminate the Agreement on such notice period as is stipulated by Fiserv if Vendor breaches this provision. So as to facilitate the audit right granted under clause 2.4(l), the Vendor warrants and represents that: 5. (a) its access logs and other similar trails relating to access to personal data, in particular by public authorities, are and will remain tamper proof (e.g. they should be made inalterable using state of the art encryption techniques, such as hashing, and also systematically transmitted to the exporter on a periodic basis) so that the auditors can find evidence of disclosure; and (b) its access logs and other similar trails distinguish between access due to regular business operations and access due to orders or requests for access. 6. The Vendor agrees to: (a) provide the notification under clause 15.1 of the EU Standard Contractual Clauses before access is granted to personal data; (b) monitor any legal or policy developments that might lead to its inability to comply with its obligations under this Addendum and promptly inform Fiserv of any such changes and developments, if possible ahead of their implementation. The Vendor agrees that if it receives any requests to access personal data, which

Following content is of title: PART B Supplementary Measures is that might lead to its inability to comply with its obligations under this Addendum and promptly inform Fiserv of any such changes and developments, if possible ahead of their implementation. The Vendor agrees that if it receives any requests to access personal data, which would mean that it can no longer give the warranty at clause 14(a) of the EU Standard Contractual Clauses, that it will promptly advise Fiserv that it will return the data to Fiserv, unless Fiserv instructs the Vendor 7. 44  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387 not to do so, the parties shall test this mechanism regularly to ensure that it can be applied on short notice. If the Vendor receives a request for the disclosure of personal data processed in connection with this Addendum from a public authority in a third country, the Vendor shall: 8. (a) inform the requesting public authority of any incompatibility of the order with the safeguards contained in the Standard Contractual Clauses and the resulting conflict of obligations for the Vendor; (b) notify simultaneously and as soon as possible Fiserv insofar as possible under the third country legal order. The Vendor shall only ever access personal data processed in connection with this Addendum, including for support purposes, in plaintext where the exporter or the data subject gives consent to this. 9. 10. The Vendor shall: (a) promptly notify the data subject of any request or order received from the public authorities of a third country, to release personal data which the Vendor processes in connection with this Addendum, so as to enable the data subject to seek information and an effective redress (e.g. by lodging a claim with his/her competent supervisory authority and/or judicial authority and demonstrate his/her standing in the courts of the third country); or (b) notify the data subject as soon as possible in the event that law to which the Vendor is subject prevents earlier notification to the data subject under section 10.a above and make best efforts to obtain a waiver of any prohibition to notify the data subject. (c) assist the data subject in exercising his/her rights in the third country through ad hoc redress mechanisms and legal counselling. If the Vendor discloses personal data in violation of these supplementary measures the Vendor agrees to compensate data subjects for any material and non-material damage suffered. 11. Vendor shall publish transparency reports annually summarizing all law enforcement requests or requests by public authorities for access to personal data, which are complied with and which are declined. 12. 45  DocuSign Envelope ID: DOC25AC0-315D-43D6-A423-CB9C9D93FD75 CW2484387
